page.title: 03EDUCATION IN CHAGFORD
page.content: Chagford has no universities, technical colleges, polytechnics or Secondary School. There is, however, a Primary School. This Primary School was originally a Secondary School but changed to a Primary one in 1971. At that time three local Primary Schools closed, namely those at{Throwleigh, {Drewsteignton and Chagford.}There are presently 140 pupils on roll, in 5 classes with 5 teachers plus the Head Teacher. School begins at 0915 and ends at 1545 with the lunch break lasting from 1215 until 1325. Children enter the school at 5 years of age and leave at 11+, to go in most cases to Okehampton College. On the school site there is also a{Playgroup}to which children of 3 to 5 years go and then enter Chagford C/E Primary School. The school has a wide curriculum content.
